info.question: How do you leverage the AWS cloud as an extension of your datacenter?
answers: Create a hardware Virtual Private Network (VPN) connection between your datacenter and your VPC
Use a Direct Connect line to connect your datacenter to your VPC
Use a Storage Gateway between your datacenter to your VPC
Use a VPN between your datacenter to your VPC
correctAnswer: Create a hardware Virtual Private Network (VPN) connection between your datacenter and your VPC

info.question: What is the Amazon VPC side of a VPN connection?
What is your side of a VPN connection with Amazon?
What enables private connectivity to services hosted in AWS, from within your VPC without using an Internet Gateway, VPN, Network Address Translation (NAT) devices, or firewall proxies?
What is a stateful gateway to provide egress only access for IPv6 traffic from the VPC to the internet?
Which AWS services do Gateway Type endpoints allow you to route traffic to through Amazon's private network by adding an entry to your route table?
Which services do Interface Type endpoints provide private connectivity to by connecting over Direct Connect?
Are data transfer charges incurred when accessing AWS services, such as S3, via your VPC's Internet Gateway?
Are data transfer charges incurred when accessing AWS resources via your VPN connection?
What type of hardware VPN connection does AWS support to connect your datacenter to you AWS VPC?
What tools are available to help you troubleshoot your Hardware VPN configuration?
What does the DescribeVPNConnection API do for you?
answers: displays the status of the VPN connection, including the state ('up/down') of each VPN tunnel and corresponding error messages if either tunnel is down
displays the status of your VPN, including the state ('active/inactive')
displays the status of your Hardware VPN configuration
correctAnswer: displays the status of the VPN connection, including the state ('up/down') of each VPN tunnel and corresponding error messages if either tunnel is down

info.question: What CIDR range are default VPCs assigned?
What CIDR range are default VPCs assigned?
How many IP address ranges for IPv4?
How many subnets can your create per VPC (if you need more you can open a ticket with AWS)?
What is the minimum size of a subnet for IPv4?
Elastic IP addresses should only be used on EC2 instances in subnets configured to route their traffic directly to the Internet Gateway?
Elastic IP can be used on EC2 instances in subnets configured to use NAT Gateway or NAT Instance to access the internet?
AWS VPCs support Elastic IPs for IPv6?
You can create a default route for each subnet in your VPC. The default route can direct traffic to egress the VPC via which of these?
Does AWS VPC support multicast or broadcast?
What is the maximum VPC size you to which you are initially limited?
You can use AMIs in a VPC that are registered whithin ________?
answers: the same region as your VPC
correctAnswer: the same region as your VPC

info.question: Can you attach or detach one or more network interfaces to an EC2 instance while it is running?
Can peering connections be created with VPCs in different regions?
Can you peer your VPC with a VPC belonging to another AWS account?
Can you use AWS Direct Connect or hardware VPN connections to access VPCs you are peered with?
answers: No, 'Edge to Edge routing' is not supported in AWS VPCs
correctAnswer: No, 'Edge to Edge routing' is not supported in AWS VPCs

info.question: Do VPC peering connections require an Internet Gateway?
Should you encrypt traffic between peered VPCs?
answers: No, traffic between EC2 instances in peered VPC remains private and isolated - similar to how traffic between two EC2 instances in the same VPC is private and isolated
correctAnswer: No, traffic between EC2 instances in peered VPC remains private and isolated - similar to how traffic between two EC2 instances in the same VPC is private and isolated

info.question: What is AWS PrivateLink?
answers: it enables customers to access services hosted on AWS in a highly available and scalable manner, while keeping all the network traffic within the AWS network
it enables customers to access services hosted on AWS in a highly available and scalable manner, while keeping all the network traffic within the customer's VPN network
correctAnswer: it enables customers to access services hosted on AWS in a highly available and scalable manner, while keeping all the network traffic within the AWS network

info.question: How many VPCs per AWS account per region can you have?
How many subnets per VPC can you have?
How many VPC Elastic IP addresses per AWS account per region can you have?
How many Internet Gateways per VPC can you have?
How many Virtual Private Gateways per AWS account per region can you have?
How many IPsec VPN Connections per Virtual Private Gateway can you have?
When you configure Auto Scaling automatic scale in, you must ____________ and set up a _________ policy?
answers: decide which EC2 instances should terminate first, termination
decide which EC2 instances should startup first, initiation
correctAnswer: decide which EC2 instances should terminate first, termination

info.question: With Auto Scaling, what do you use to prevent specific instances from being terminated during automatic scale in?
With the default Auto Scaling termination policy, the behavior of the Auto Scaling Group has which of these as the first step?
answers: If there are instances in multiple AZs, select the AZ with the most instances and at least one instance that is not protected from scale in. If there is more than one AZ with this number of instances, select the AZ with the instances that use the oldest launch configuration

If there are instances in multiple AZs, select the AZ with the least instances and at least one instance that is not protected from scale in. If there is more than one AZ with this number of instances, select the AZ with the instances that use the oldest launch configuration

If there are instances in multiple AZs, select the AZ with the most instances and at least one instance that is not protected from scale in. If there is more than one AZ with this number of instances, select the AZ with the instances that use the newest launch configuration
correctAnswer: If there are instances in multiple AZs, select the AZ with the most instances and at least one instance that is not protected from scale in. If there is more than one AZ with this number of instances, select the AZ with the instances that use the oldest launch configuration

info.question: With the default Auto Scaling termination policy, the behavior of the Auto Scaling Group has which of these as the second step?
answers: Determine which unprotected instances in the selected AZ use the oldest launch configuration. If there is one such instance, terminate it
Determine which unprotected instances in the selected AZ use the newest launch configuration. If there is one such instance, terminate it
Determine which unprotected instances in the selected AZ use the oldest launch configuration. If there is one such instance, suspend it
correctAnswer: Determine which unprotected instances in the selected AZ use the oldest launch configuration. If there is one such instance, terminate it

info.question: With the default Auto Scaling termination policy, the behavior of the Auto Scaling Group has which of these as the third step?
answers: If there are multiple instances that use the oldest launch configuration, determine which unprotected instances are closest to the next billing hour. If there is one such instance, terminate it
If there are multiple instances that use the newest launch configuration, determine which unprotected instances are closest to the next billing hour. If there is one such instance, terminate it
If there are multiple instances that use the oldest launch configuration, determine which unprotected instances are closest to the previous billing hour. If there is one such instance, terminate it
correctAnswer: If there are multiple instances that use the oldest launch configuration, determine which unprotected instances are closest to the next billing hour. If there is one such instance, terminate it

info.question: With the default Auto Scaling termination policy, the behavior of the Auto Scaling Group has which of these as the fourth (last) step?
answers: If there is more than one unprotected instance closest to the next billing hour, select one of these instances at random and terminate it
If there is more than one unprotected instance closest to the next billing hour, select the one of these instances that is first in the list and terminate it
If there is more than one unprotected instance closest to the next billing hour, select the one of these instances that is last in the list and terminate it
correctAnswer: If there is more than one unprotected instance closest to the next billing hour, select one of these instances at random and terminate it

info.question: AWS EC2 Auto Scaling supports which of these as custom termination policies?

Which AWS EC2 Auto Scaling custom termination policy is useful when you are upgrading the EC2 instances in the Auto Scaling Group to a new EC2 instance type. You can gradually replace instances of the old type with instances of the new type?
Which AWS EC2 Auto Scaling custom termination policy is useful when you are testing a new launch configuration but don't want to keep it in production?
Which AWS EC2 Auto Scaling custom termination policy is useful when you are updating a group and phasing out the instances from a previous configuration?
Which AWS EC2 Auto Scaling custom termination policy helps you maximize the use of your instances and manage your EC2 usage costs?
Which AWS EC2 Auto Scaling custom termination policy is useful when you have more than one scaling policy for the group?
What do you use to control whether an Auto Scaling Group can terminate a particular instance when scaling in?
